bestBHT.bht: Jesus was informed by a group of individuals that His mother and brothers were waiting outside, wanting to see Him and have a conversation with Him. This message was relayed to Him, similar to the account in Matthew 12:47.

Archibald T. Robertson: Was told (απηγγελη). Second aorist passive indicative of απαγγελλω, to bring word or tidings. Common verb. See on Mark 3:32 and Matthew 12:47 for details.
John Gill: And it was told him by certain, which said...
Thy mother, and thy brethren, stand without, desiring to see thee; and to speak with thee...

bhtAttempts.bht: Certain people came and gave Jesus a message, saying that His mother and brothers were outside, wanting to see Him and speak with Him. This information was brought to Him and delivered by these individuals. The situation is similar to Matthew 12:47, where Jesus is informed about His family's presence.

Certain people came and brought word to Jesus, saying that His mother and brothers were standing outside, desiring to see Him and speak with Him. This information was communicated to Him, as was also mentioned in Matthew 12:47.

It was brought to Jesus' attention by certain individuals that His mother and brothers were outside, desiring to see Him and speak with Him. This message was delivered to Him, and it resembles the situation described in Matthew 12:47.

Jesus was informed by a group of individuals that His mother and brothers were waiting outside, wanting to see Him and have a conversation with Him. This message was relayed to Him, similar to the account in Matthew 12:47.

Certain people approached Jesus and brought him word that his mother and brothers were outside, desiring to see him and speak with him. This echoes a similar incident in Matthew 12:47, indicating the significance of Jesus' relationship with his family. (Source: Bible commentaries)
